results.title: Model 621 Sound Projector with tripod and stand
results.credit_line: ACMI Collection. Tripod donated by Daryl Annett.
results.brief_description: In 1951, this projector was brought to the Koomooloo Station in South Australia to entertain workers during the shearing season.

constellations_primary.name: Bell & Howell Projector 621: This picture has been edited for content
constellations_primary.description: The Bell & Howell-Gaumont Model 621 projector was originally used entertain the shearers on a sheep farm in South Australia with the films screened sometimes edited for distribution.

results.title_for_label: Model 621 Sound Projector with tripod and stand
results.description: Though it was made in England, this projector made it over 15,000kms to the Koomooloo Station in South Australia. Situated on pastoral land in the Murray and Mellee region of South Australia, Koomooloo Station operated as a sheep station from 1868 and in 1951, this projector was bought to entertain workers during the shearing season. Luckily it has a vent at the back of the casing to keep it cool because if it was used inside a shearing shed the heat would’ve been insufferable.
description_for_label: Though it was made in England, this projector made it over 15,000kms to the Koomooloo Station in South Australia. Situated on pastoral land in the Murray and Mellee region of South Australia, Koomooloo Station operated as a sheep station from 1868 and in 1951, this projector was bought to entertain workers during the shearing season. Luckily it has a vent at the back of the casing to keep it cool because if it was used inside a shearing shed the heat would’ve been insufferable.

results.title: Moby Dick
results.creator_credit: John Huston, Moulin Films, Warner Bros Pictures and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Huston had for a long time wanted to direct a version of Herman Melville’s classic novel. This superbly photographed epic features a thrilling performance by Gregory Peck as Captain Ahab, the man obsessed with killing the white whale which claimed his leg. The meticulous attention that Huston pays to the details of the sailors’ lives and work is an apt cinematic rendering of Melville’s realist prose. Though much maligned on its initial release, “Moby Dick” is now considered a flawed but magnificent achievement by one of America’s most famous directors. Also starring Richard Basehart and Orson Welles. The script was co-authored by Huston and Ray Bradbury.

results.title: Mobility
results.creator_credit: Roger Hart, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Examines the complex range of problems involved in Third World urban transport, from cost and available technology to the different needs of the industrialized middle class and the urban poor, and proposes some surprising solutions. This film explores how transportation planners and city governments try to solve the problems associated with the growth of cities, especially the increased pressure on existing transportation systems.

results.title: Mobil movielogue. No. 10
results.brief_description: Documentary film about the various uses of petroleum. Features the Fisherman’s Bend Commonwealth Aircraft factory; shows the manufacturing and testing of Rolls Royce jet engines as used in RAAF Vampire aircraft; the Rover gas turbine car on test tracks; launch of petrol tanker; Altona Refinery opening; Army petrol driven vehicles; speed boats on Sydney Harbour; Bathurst - Mount Panorama circuit in action.

results.title: Moana Roa
results.brief_description: Life among the Polynesian people who inhabit New Zealand’s Cook Islands. The sea plays an important part in the lives of these people; they are expert spear fisherman and gain much of their food from the sea; singing and dancing and also canoe racing are popular pastimes with the islanders. The film reviews health and educational services provided by the administration and mentions the exports of the Islands - copra, oranges, bananas and pineapples.

results.title: Moana
results.creator_credit: Lisa Keane, Ron Clements, Walt Disney Animation Studios and John Musker
results.brief_description: In Ancient Polynesia, when a terrible curse incurred by Maui reaches an impetuous Chieftain’s daughter’s island, she answers the Ocean’s call to seek out the demigod to set things right.

constellations_other.name: Little J & Big Cuz to Blade
constellations_other.description: Discover how some of the best indigenous works connect to comic book blockbusters and martial arts videogames.

constellations_other.name: Go Bang
constellations_other.description: Australian dance act PNAU are renowned for groundbreaking visuals in their music videos, including for their 2017 single 'Go Bang' which featured Kira Divine.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Lisa Keane, Ron Clements, Walt Disney Animation Studios and John Musker
results.description:
In ancient Polynesia, the young, soon-to-be-chieftain Moana must enlist the help of the shape-shifting demi-god Maui to find the heart of the goddess Te Fiti, and save her home from encroaching darkness by defying her father and venturing across the sea to confront Te Kā, the volcanic demon who defeated Maui a millennia ago.

Directed by animation legends Ron Clements and John Musker (The Little Mermaid (1989), Aladdin (1992), and featuring the voice talents of Auli’i Cravalho, Dwayne ‘The Rock’ Johnson, Temuera Morrison, Jemaine Clement and Rachel House, as well as songs penned by Hamilton’s Lin-Manuel Miranda, Moana is a breathtaking instant classic from Walt Disney Animation Studios.

This stunning concept art by Lisa Keane explores the budding relationship between baby Moana and the ocean, who becomes an important guide on her adventure.
description_for_label:
In ancient Polynesia, the young, soon-to-be-chieftain Moana must enlist the help of the shape-shifting demi-god Maui to find the heart of the goddess Te Fiti, and save her home from encroaching darkness by defying her father and venturing across the sea to confront Te Kā, the volcanic demon who defeated Maui a millennia ago.

Directed by animation legends Ron Clements and John Musker (The Little Mermaid (1989), Aladdin (1992), and featuring the voice talents of Auli’i Cravalho, Dwayne ‘The Rock’ Johnson, Temuera Morrison, Jemaine Clement and Rachel House, as well as songs penned by Hamilton’s Lin-Manuel Miranda, Moana is a breathtaking instant classic from Walt Disney Animation Studios.

This stunning concept art by Lisa Keane explores the budding relationship between baby Moana and the ocean, who becomes an important guide on her adventure.

results.title: Mo' better blues
results.creator_credit: Spike Lee, 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Award winning actor Denzel Washington gives a rivetting performance in Spike Lee’s breathtaking film about music and love. Talented trumpeter, (Washington), is obsessed by his music and is indecisive about his girlfriends Indigo and Clarke. When he is forced to come to the aid of his manager and childhood friend (Spike Lee), Bleek finds his world more fragile than he ever imagined. Stunning cinematography, a rousing score and superlative performances combine in an unforgettable feast of the senses. Also stars John Turturro and Wesley Snipes.

results.title: Mixing solutions
results.brief_description: Looks at safety measures to adopt when mixing chemical herbicides in a farming situation. Gives sound advice in an easily followed format.

results.title: Mixed blood
results.creator_credit: Paul Morrissey, Steven Fierberg, Antoine Gannage and Sara Films
results.brief_description: Morrissey’s post-Warhol feature film about gang violence in New York’s Alphabet City. Marilia Pera is outstanding as the Brazilian leader of the Mercentanos gang. She is a drug-dealer and pimp, but also mother to a group of teenage boys who obey her every command, be it shooting a rival or doing the laundry. “Mixed Blood” is violent and disturbing but it maintains a comic tone throughout that refuses sentimentality and cliche. This is a drug “exploitation” movie scored to a festive, breezy Latin beat.

results.title: Mix a material
results.creator_credit: Christopher Haws, Michael Latham, Landmark Films and Video Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Start Here: Adventures into Science”.
Looks at why materials bend, stretch and break. Demonstrates experiments to show the behaviour of molecular lattices in everyday substances from chocolate to rubber ballons.
